Social Security Recipients To Receive Extra Payment by Martha Benavides Posted: 04.03.2009 at 11:02 PM 0 More RGV News Videos
Port of Brownsville seeing huge shift in business
2 hours, 45 minutes ago Brownsville Port of Entry Public Information Officer Manuel Ortiz came to Action 4 Sunrise to talk about the major expansion and economic growth the port is experiencing. read story view photos watch video Report: Manager refused to discard potentially hazardous foods in broken fridge
Yesterday at 11:01 PM A Raymondville restaurant is exposed on Food 4 Thought for storing potentially hazardous foods inside a broken refrigerator. read story view photos watch video Water district considers rate hike for McAllen area
Yesterday at 5:50 PM If you live in McAllen, you may soon be paying more for your water. read story view photos watch video Identifying remains found in Edinburg "could take months"
Yesterday at 5:40 PM Piles of dirt have started to accumulate down a small dirt road in North Edinburg as police and city workers continued their search for more human remains. read story view photos watch video Port Of Brownsville goes "Hollywood"
Yesterday at 5:31 PM The Port of Brownsville transformed itself into a movie set complete with a production team and actors on Wednesday. read story view photos watch video Massive fire diverts traffic off U.S. 77
Yesterday at 5:15 PM Authorities have arrested a man who allegedly burned trash without a permit and they believe is responsible for a massive brush fire that diverted traffic off U.S. Highway 77 in Combes. read story view photos watch video GOP-controlled House votes to repeal health law
Yesterday at 3:20 PM It was the 33rd time in 18 months, but the measure is doomed to fail in the Senate read story watch video GOP says health care repeal also stops a tax
Yesterday at 7:10 AM GOP casts repeal of Obama's health care law as a chance to stop a tax read story watch video Nature Report: Fawn Moments
Yesterday at 5:28 AM Fawns are among natures most captivating young. Richard Moore takes us out into the South Texas wildlands where they are being born. With the help of Weslaco native Mario Aleman, he puts the beauty of fawns to music. read story view photos watch video Border Patrol to close 6 interior stations in Texas as part of new strategy
Tuesday, July 10, 2012 Texas will take the biggest hit with the Border Patrol station closings. read story view photos watch video Program offers assistance paying electric bill
Tuesday, July 10, 2012 In her 60's, Olivia Sosa didn't imagine she would have to be choosing between paying her electric bill or paying for her medications, but she did find herself in that exact position. read story view photos watch video
